data.title: All Turkish academics banned from traveling abroad – report

Two Arrested in Turkey for Insulting Erdogan on Social Media
US air strike in Syria kills up to 85 civilians 'mistaken for Isil fighters'
Turkey blocks access to WikiLeaks after release of 300k govt emails over post-coup purges

Christians in Russia are now banned from discussing their faith outside of churches and other designated places under new anti-terror laws. From Wednesday onwards it is illegal to preach, teach or share faith outside state-controlled settings.

A Palestinian boy who was filmed being beheaded by Syrian rebels on Tuesday was not a fighter, a pro-government Palestinian militia has said. The Liwa al-Quds (Jerusalem Brigade) said Abdullah Issa was just a 12-year-old from a poor refugee family who lived in a rebel-held area of Aleppo.
People playing the popular smartphone game Pokémon Go in Bosnia have been urged to avoid areas littered with unexploded mines left over from the 1990s conflict.
U.S. and Russian Scientists Are Making Plans to Go Back to the Moon Together
Women are being silenced in Turkey's crackdown
